data.title: Go every chance we can
data.text: Nice ladies Carman and Bertha are great waitresses, patient, and efficient,  food is really tasty ,love the tacos and chili realenos.Prices are affordable, Easy parking.

data.title: Manudo soup every day
data.text: This is one of the few places in town that serves manudo soup every day and it's good. The restaurant is a bit run down. Street parking is ample and free.

data.title: Small, but good food.
data.text: Pretty small and tight inside. Outside is much better, if it isn't too hot outside. We sat at an awkward/random spot. Our table was placed right in front of the Juke Box. The back of my seat was literally against/touching the jukebox. It seemed like the table didn't belong there in that particular, it was kinda odd. It was nice and quiet when all of the sudden the music began playing really loud. Me and my wife could barely hear each other. Other than that, the food was really good. We went there for breakfast. Perhaps we will go again, but we'll make sure we get a better table.

data.title: Real
data.text: Overall if you're looking for a good meal with good service this is the place to go. As you walk in, it isn't much to look at but the food wins out. Small, simple and tasty with cold beers. Not much else to ask for.

user_location.name: El Puerto de Santa Maria, Spain

data.title: Nayarit our favorite
data.text: Nyarit is our favorite Mexican restaurant in the area. Great food, large servings and friendly staff. Outdoor patio with relaxed atmosphere. Not fancy and very affordable. We love their Rancho Huevos and the thin sliced fried potatoes that comes with it along with rice and beans.

data.title: great food, great price.
data.text: I work a few doors down and have eaten here many times. the food is always great and very inexpensive. the place is being remodeled so the bathrooms may be improved. always a great place to eat cheap!

data.title: best homemade tortillas ever
data.text: Me and my husband had breakfast there.The homemade corn tortillias, rock and the food was awesome i cant complain about a thing maby the others who went are used to white mexican food and need to learn how to cook. Or visit a fake mexican resturant like TACO BELL ........

data.title: Never again
data.text: My husband and I went to have dinner here.  I ordered the chicken and mole dinner, he had the carne asada plate.  My chicken was not cooked all the way and the mole was terrible as well as their rice and bean.  My husbands dinner wasn't any better,  We left most of it.  I used the restroom or no I didn't it was so dirty and smelly.  The place was pretty full of guys drinking not really eating.  Don't think we will ever go back there again.  Every time we pass we both say I can't believe they are still in business.  Must make their money on the beer sales.

data.title: Less than satisfactory.
data.text: With my car in for repairs, I was looking for a place to have lunch. Nayarit was just a few doors over, so  I stopped in. The place was about 3/4 full, so I figured they knew what they were doing. And I was seated fairly quickly. But I made the mistake of ordering a combo dinner  for lunch, which they were apparenly not prepared for. Service took nearly an hour, and the rice appeared to be left over from the day before. Dehydrated and crunchy. Once the meal was over, I could not find the waitress, cashier, or any other personnel. Ten minutes later, I was finally able to pay for the meal and leave. I was disappointed. But the other patrons seemed happy enough. Maybe I'm just too picky.
